concepts.content: A Venn diagram consists of a universal set U represented by a rectangle, and subsets within it that are generally represented by circles.

If A and B are two sets, then A ∩ B is the intersection of A and B, and consists of all elements which are in both A and B. A ∪ B is the union of A and B, and consists of all elements which are in A or B (or both).
The complement of a set A is represented by the region outside the circle which represents A.
If A is a subset of B, we place a circle representing A completely within the circle representing B. Every element of A is also an element of B.
The intersection of two sets A and B is represented by the region where the circles representing A and B overlap. Elements in this region are elements of both A and B.
The union of two sets A and B is represented by the region inside one or both of the circles representing A and B. Elements in this region are elements of either A or B.
Disjoint sets A and B are represented by two circles which do not overlap. There are no elements that are members of both A and B.
If the sets are disjoint and exhaustive then B = A' and A ∪ B = U. We can represent this situation without using circles.
Two sets are disjoint or mutually exclusive if they have no elements in common. If A and B are disjoint then A ∩ B = ∅.

problem.statement: Consider the set S = {2, 4, 6, 7} within the universal set U = {x | x ≤ 10, x ∈ Z⁺}.

parts.question: Draw a Venn diagram to show S.
List the elements of the complement set S'.
Find: i) n(S)  ii) n(S')  iii) n(U)

parts.answer: Venn diagram with S containing {2, 4, 6, 7} and elements {1, 3, 5, 8, 9, 10} outside S but inside U
i) n(S) = 4  ii) n(S') = 6  iii) n(U) = 10

problem.statement: Illustrate the following numbers on a Venn diagram: √3, 8½, -2, 7.1, 16, 0.115

solution.description: Venn diagram showing nested sets R (real numbers), Q (rationals), Z (integers), N (natural numbers) with: 16 in N, -2 in Z, 7.1 and 8½ and 0.115 in Q, √3 in R (irrational)

parts.explanation: {2 and 5 are elements of both sets}
{elements of either A or B or both}

problem.statement: Let P = {b, c, f, g, h} and Q = {c, d, g, i}. Find:

parts.answer: P ∩ Q = {c, g}
parts.explanation: {c and g are elements of both sets}

parts.answer: P ∪ Q = {b, c, d, f, g, h, i}

problem.statement: A = {2, 4, 7, 10}, B = {prime numbers less than 10} and C = {factors of 15}.

parts.question: Find: i) A ∩ B  ii) A ∩ C  iii) B ∩ C

answers.explanation: {2 and 7 are common to A and B}
{no elements are common to A and C}
{3 and 5 are common to B and C}

parts.answer: A and C have no elements in common, so A and C are disjoint.

parts.answer: Every element in A is also in B, so A ⊆ B.
A ∩ B = ∅, so A and B are disjoint sets.

problem.statement: Shade the region of a Venn diagram representing:

parts.question: in A but not in B

parts.answer: Elements in this region are in both A and B (intersection)

parts.description: B is a subset of A

parts.answer: A and B are disjoint but A ∪ B ≠ U
A and B are disjoint and exhaustive

problem.statement: On separate Venn diagrams shade these regions for two overlapping sets A and B:

parts.answer: A ∪ B means in A, B, or both
A' ∩ B means outside A intersected with B
parts.description: Only the part of B not overlapping with A is shaded

parts.answer: (A ∩ B)' means outside the intersection of A and B
parts.description: Everything except the overlapping region is shaded

problem.statement: Suppose U = {positive integers ≤ 12}, A = {primes ≤ 12}, and B = {factors of 12}.

parts.question: List the elements of the sets A and B.

List the elements in: i) A'  ii) A ∩ B  iii) A ∪ B
Find: i) n(A ∩ B)  ii) n(A ∪ B)  iii) n(B')

parts.answer: Venn diagram showing the sets with intersection {2, 3}

parts.question: Show set A on a Venn diagram.

Betty has roses and daisies in her garden. Her roses flower every year from March to August, and her daisies flower from May to November. Let R be the set of months that the roses flower, and D be the set of months that the daisies flower.

parts.question: State the universal set U in this case.
List the elements of R and D.
Find R ∩ D. What does this set represent?
Find R ∪ D. What does this set represent?
Find (R ∪ D)'. What does this set represent?

parts.question: List the elements of P and Q.

problems.problem: Roxanne is baking biscuits and cake. The ingredients for each are shown. Let B be the set of ingredients needed to make the biscuits, and C be the set of ingredients needed to make the cake.

parts.question: List the elements of B and C.
Find B ∩ C. What does this set represent?
How many different ingredients will Roxanne use in her baking? How does your answer relate to B ∪ C?

parts.question: List the elements of A, B, C and D.
Which pairs of sets are disjoint?

problems.problem: At an international convention, most of the delegates can speak multiple languages. Eduardo can speak Portuguese, Spanish and Japanese. Fernanda can speak Spanish and French. Gordon can speak English and French. Huan can speak Chinese, Japanese and English.

parts.question: List the elements of E, F, G and H.
Find: i) E ∩ F  ii) E ∩ G  iii) E ∩ H  iv) F ∩ G  v) F ∩ H  vi) G ∩ H
Which language would be spoken between: i) Eduardo and Huan  ii) Gordon and Fernanda?
Explain why delegates cannot communicate with each other if their language set is disjoint.
Which delegates cannot communicate with each other?

visual_representations.description: For A = {1, 4, 8} and U = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9}, the Venn diagram shows circle A containing {1, 4, 8} inside rectangle U with {2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 9} outside the circle.
Venn diagram displaying real numbers, rational numbers, integers, and natural numbers as nested sets. Contains examples like √2, 0.3333..., √8, -5, 0, 10, etc.
Two Venn diagrams showing: A ∩ B is shaded red (overlapping region), A ∪ B is shaded green (both circles).
Venn diagram showing A = {2, 3, 4, 7} and B = {1, 3, 7, 8, 10} with intersection {3, 7} and union {1, 2, 3, 4, 7, 8, 10}. Elements 5, 6, 9 are outside both sets but inside U.
